channel.title: My Axo Sampler is not Mono compatible
channel.description: I have a Axo Sampler where I can sample in Mono and play those samples with a USB Keyboard. I have a knob that is sending the signal into a reverb so I use the stereo out to have a stereo reverb. But I realized that the dry signal is not centered anymore and when I listen to the stereo out in mono I am loosing signal and it sounds like there is some cancellation going on. What could that be? The patch is attached! sampler 3.0.axp (89.3 KB)

item.title: My Axo Sampler is not Mono compatible
item.dc:creator: @Blindsmyth Simon
item.description:
@Blindsmyth wrote:

Hey Kryshe,

I've had huge phase issues with a stereo looper patch and I found out that execution order can be a big problem with stereo processing in axoloti. It could be that your left channel is processed one cycle earlier then the right and thus creating these cancellation problems.

With my patch in the end I moved the left and right channel loopplayers to the same spot, so that they would be processed in the same moment in execution order. so try to move both math/+ to the same place?

Bildschirmfoto 2021-11-15 um 23.14.22.png1022x516 34.8 KB

Read full topic
item.source: My Axo Sampler is not Mono compatible

item.title: My Axo Sampler is not Mono compatible

item.description:
@kryshe wrote:

I have a Axo Sampler where I can sample in Mono and play those samples with a USB Keyboard. I have a knob that is sending the signal into a reverb so I use the stereo out to have a stereo reverb. But I realized that the dry signal is not centered anymore and when I listen to the stereo out in mono I am loosing signal and it sounds like there is some cancellation going on.
What could that be? The patch is attached!
